translation.en: and there's no getting around it, um,

translation.ja: オハイオ州ハミルトン郡 君の証言は 手元にある証拠と一致しない 君の証言は 手元にある証拠と一致しない

translation.ja: 捜査した結果― 捜査した結果― ワイオミング州 オールバニ郡

translation.ja: サンディエゴ警察 元警官 年を追うごとに 通報件数は増えてた 年を追うごとに 通報件数は増えてた 年を追うごとに 通報件数は増えてた カール･ハーシュマン 年を追うごとに 通報件数は増えてた

translation.en: You don't think I can… an 18-year-old can come up, and I can talk her out of coming forward.

translation.en: Oh, I can.

translation.en: Uh, oh yeah, Cathy. Yeah, yeah, I read your case. Yeah, sorry this happened to you.

translation.en: Hey, look, um, I'm gonna tell you right now,
translation.ja: “よく聞いてくれ”

translation.en: because you were making out with this guy or his friend before, uh, that's not gonna look good.
translation.ja: “前に彼とキスしたなら 印象が悪い”

translation.en: So, and the DA, they're gonna frown upon that you were drinking underage.
translation.ja: “未成年の飲酒を 検事に咎(とが)められる”

translation.en: Okay, thanks.

translation.en: Click. Bang. Sign it off. Hand it in.
translation.ja: これで この件は解決だ

translation.en: [Jones] Now you're 20?

translation.en: -[Megan] Yes. -[Jones] And you got a fake ID?

translation.en: And… And you said that you

translation.en: had five cups of beer?

translation.en: [Megan] Yeah.

translation.en: -[Emma] Yes. -[Akridge] Did y'all drink any of it?

translation.en: This is what I think.

translation.ja: 君とスティーヴンは 合意の上で性交した

translation.en: You freak out a little bit…
translation.ja: 君は怖くなり…

translation.en: [male investigator] Everything was good? Consensual? Both you guys are grown adults.
translation.ja: 合意の上で 大人同士が性交しただけだ

translation.en: You don't wanna ruin this guy's life, do you?
translation.ja: 彼を破滅させたいか？

translation.en: -You don't wanna see him go to prison. -Deep down he's a good dude.

translation.en: I mean, you guys just made a mistake.
translation.ja: 過ちは犯したが 彼も善人なんだ

translation.en: You go your way. He'll go his way. We're gonna go our way.
translation.ja: 君と彼は別の道を進めばいい

translation.en: [Rachel] In most of the cases I looked at,
translation.ja: ほとんどのケースで

translation.en: the alleged assailant was known somehow to the reporting victim,
translation.ja: 加害者とされる人物と 被害者は顔見知りか―

translation.en: or there was a brief encounter before the incident.
translation.ja: 事件直前に接触があった

translation.en: [Rachel] That opens up the possibility the police could say there was consent.
translation.ja: 合意があると警察が 判断する材料になり得る

translation.en: [Rachel] But then I found a case about a total stranger.
translation.ja: でも赤の他人同士の 事件を見つけた

translation.en: [reporter] King University student claimed that a law enforcement officer
translation.ja: キング大学の学生が 警官もしくは―

translation.en: or person impersonating an officer assaulted her during a traffic stop.
translation.ja: 警官に成りすました男に 暴行されたと偽証

translation.en: The sheriff's office says Dyanie Bermeo admitted that she lied
translation.ja: ダイアニ･ベルメオは ウソを認め―

translation.en: and charged her with giving false report to law enforcement.
translation.ja: 虚偽の報告をした罪に 問われています

translation.en: [Rachel] I got wind of Dyanie's case as it was unfolding,
translation.ja: ダイアニの事件を 報道で知り―

translation.en: and I met Melissa who is fighting Dyanie's false reporting charge at no cost.
translation.ja: 彼女の弁護を無償で務める メリッサに話を聞いた

translation.en: Like, I saw the story.
translation.ja: 事件を知り 何か変だと思ったの ダイアニの弁護士

translation.en: -[Rachel] Yeah. -It didn't sit well with me.
translation.ja: 事件を知り 何か変だと思ったの ダイアニの弁護士 事件を知り 何か変だと思ったの 事件を知り 何か変だと思ったの メリッサ･ ホーディチャック

translation.en: And I just wanted to let her know,
translation.ja: だから彼女に連絡した

translation.en: you know, if she wants to talk about it, I'm here. I'm also an attorney…
translation.ja: だから彼女に連絡した 弁護士として 力になれるとね

translation.en: [Rachel, voiceover] Her case caught my attention
translation.ja: この件に注目したのは―

translation.en: because it's so different from the others I've been investigating.
translation.ja: この件に注目したのは― これまで調べた件とは 違ったからだ バージニア州アビンドン

translation.en: Dyanie says she was assaulted by a total stranger.
translation.ja: ダイアニは面識のない人物に 襲われたと証言

translation.en: And so, if police aren't disputing consent in the case,
translation.ja: 合意がないことは 明確なのに―

translation.en: what is the basis for their doubt?
translation.ja: なぜ警察は彼女を疑ったのか

translation.en: My name is Dyanie Bermeo.
translation.ja: 私はダイアニ･ベルメオ

translation.en: I go to school at King University,
translation.ja: キング大学の学生よ

translation.en: and I'm a double major in psychology and criminal justice.
translation.ja: 心理学と刑事司法学を 専攻してる

translation.en: I remember I was in eighth grade.
translation.ja: 「ＬＡＷ ＆ ＯＲＤＥＲ 性犯罪特捜班」 「ＬＡＷ ＆ ＯＲＤＥＲ 性犯罪特捜班」 中２の時 ドラマの テーマ曲が聞こえたから

translation.en: I would hear the Law & Order theme song coming on,
translation.ja: 「ＬＡＷ ＆ ＯＲＤＥＲ 性犯罪特捜班」 中２の時 ドラマの テーマ曲が聞こえたから 中２の時 ドラマの テーマ曲が聞こえたから

translation.en: and I was like, "Dad, why are you watching this? Like, just change it."
translation.ja: 父親に番組を変えてと言った

translation.en: And he was just like, "Sit down and actually watch an episode with me."
translation.ja: でも誘われて観てみると―

translation.en: And I got hooked.
translation.ja: 夢中になった

translation.en: I'm Detective Benson.
translation.ja: 私はベンソン刑事

translation.en: Who are you?
translation.ja: あなたは？

translation.en: I'm Dori.
translation.ja: ドリよ

translation.en: [Dyanie, voiceover] My favorite detective probably would be Olivia Benson.
translation.ja: お気に入りは オリビア･ベンソン刑事よ

translation.en: You know where she is!
translation.ja: 彼女はどこ？

translation.en: [Dyanie, continuing] I used to just love watching her catch the bad guy
translation.ja: 悪人を逮捕する彼女に 憧れてた

translation.en: and just how she pieced all the clues together and everything.
translation.ja: 彼女は手がかりや 証拠をたどり―

translation.en: The hints, the evidence. And it was awesome.
translation.ja: 事件を解決する

translation.en: We've got names, addresses, dates of birth, Social Security numbers.
translation.ja: 名前 住所 誕生日 社会保障番号よ

translation.en: I knew I wanted to be a cop.
translation.ja: 警官になりたかった

translation.en: But this past year,
translation.ja: でも この１年で

translation.en: that hope of trying to be a… like, trying to make a difference…
translation.ja: 世の中を 変えたいという夢は―

translation.en: [tearfully] …just wasn't there anymore.
translation.ja: 消えてしまった

translation.en: [Dyanie] I was 21 at the time.
translation.ja: 当時 私は21才だった

translation.en: I was driving back to campus, and I was listening to music.
translation.ja: 大学に向かい運転しながら 音楽を聴いてたの

translation.en: And then for a flash second, I was looking up at my rearview mirror,
translation.ja: 一瞬 バックミラーを 見ると―

translation.en: and I saw blue lights, and I was just like, "Are you kidding me?"
translation.ja: 青いライトが見えたから 運が悪いと思った

translation.en: So, I pulled over,
translation.ja: 路肩に車を止めると…

translation.en: and the officer came to my window,
translation.ja: 路肩に車を止めると… 警官にスピード違反だと 言われた

translation.en: and he said, "Did you know how fast you were going?"
translation.ja: 警官にスピード違反だと 言われた

translation.en: And I was like, "No, sir. It couldn't have been more than 40."
translation.ja: 私は65キロ以下だったと 答えた

translation.en: He was, like, "Okay, well, can you step out of the vehicle?"
translation.ja: 車から降りるよう 言われたから―

translation.en: I asked him why,
translation.ja: 理由を聞いた

translation.en: and he was just, like,
translation.ja: 彼は言ったわ

translation.en: "Well if you're gonna be this much trouble,
translation.ja: “手間を取らせるなら”

translation.en: I can call for backup and have five to six officers out here."

translation.en: And as soon as I got out of the vehicle, he didn't even let me look at him or anything. He turned me around.

translation.en: He started searching me like…

translation.en: Like, he went like this. He didn't go under my shirt or anything,

translation.en: and then he went in between my legs. I was just standing there.

translation.en: I didn't want to look. I had my eyes closed and everything.

translation.en: He got back in his car, and he drove off.

translation.en: The first person I called was my dad.

translation.en: And I remember crying to him, and I told him to not be mad.

translation.en: I had told him that I was going to talk to the police… [sniffles]

translation.en: and there's been a number of cases where I've served as an expert witness

translation.ja: タイヤ店に監視カメラがある

translation.en: Right. Maybe we'll get his car on there, and then we can confront him with it.
translation.ja: 彼の車が映ってたら 証拠になると思ったんだろう 彼の車が映ってたら 証拠になると思ったんだろう ダイアニが停車した地点

translation.en: That's great.
translation.ja: 彼の車が映ってたら 証拠になると思ったんだろう ダイアニが停車した地点

translation.en: First video was from a gas station

translation.en: that nobody ever mentions they drove past.

translation.en: They call, and they talked to Adam.

translation.en: No… No last name.

translation.ja: 彼に追尾されてると 気づかなかった

translation.en: [Dyanie] And I pulled over…

translation.en: right here.

translation.en: Oh.

translation.ja: 事件の証拠として使われた―

translation.en: -[Melissa] Yeah, that one. Yep. -[Rachel] Okay.

translation.en: is whenever I felt like

translation.en: they… they just turned, and they didn't believe me anymore.
translation.ja: 彼らは もう私を 信用してないとね

translation.en: I didn't even think about asking, like,

translation.en: -Okay. -So there goes one car.

translation.en: All they need is one car going by and claim it is a Kia Soul.
translation.ja: これがキアだと 警察は主張した

translation.en: -They made their minds up. -Right, yeah.
translation.ja: そう決めつけ―

translation.ja: 彼女を問い詰める つもりだった

translation.ja: ウソつき呼ばわりは したくない

translation.en: [Dyanie] Yeah.

translation.en: [male investigator] Okay, but what I see you doing is digging your hole deeper.
translation.ja: だが君が否定すれば 状況は悪化する

translation.ja: だが君が否定すれば 状況は悪化する ここだけの話にするから 真実を話してくれ

translation.en: -But we need you to tell us the truth. -[Dyanie] Okay.
translation.ja: ここだけの話にするから 真実を話してくれ 分かった

translation.en: [male investigator] Okay?

translation.en: No stop happened, did it?

translation.en: [Dyanie] I don't know.

translation.en: The moment he says,
translation.ja: 偽証した理由は 〝分からない〞だった

translation.en: "Well, why did you do this?" And she says, "I don't know."
translation.ja: 偽証した理由は 〝分からない〞だった サンディエゴ警察 元警官 偽証した理由は 〝分からない〞だった 偽証した理由は 〝分からない〞だった カール･ハーシュマン

translation.en: Instead of saying, "I was doing poorly in school,"
translation.ja: カール･ハーシュマン 学校の成績が 悪かったわけじゃない

translation.en: which she wasn't, "I was fighting with my boyfriend,"
translation.ja: 学校の成績が 悪かったわけじゃない 彼氏とケンカしたり―

translation.en: which she wasn't,
translation.ja: 彼氏とケンカしたり―

translation.en: "I was having personal problems at home," which she wasn't.
translation.ja: 悩みがあったわけでもない

translation.en: She doesn't need the attention of this,

translation.en: but they needed that admission from her, so they tricked her.
translation.ja: 警官は自白のために 彼女を騙した

translation.en: [Dyanie] I got a call from Detective Adkins,
translation.ja: 〝逮捕されたら お任せを！〞 アドキンス刑事から 電話があった アドキンス刑事から 電話があった

translation.en: and he asked me if it was okay if I could come to the station
translation.ja: 書類に署名が必要だから

translation.en: and sign some paperwork to close off the case.
translation.ja: 警察署に来てくれと 言われた

translation.en: He sat me down, and he was, like, "There's no other way to tell you this,
translation.ja: 彼は私を座らせると こう切り出した

translation.en: but we have to charge you with filing a false police report."
translation.ja: 彼は私を座らせると こう切り出した “虚偽告訴罪で 君を逮捕する”

translation.en: "You wasted so many people's time and everything."
translation.ja: “君は大勢の時間を ムダにした”

translation.en: "So that's why we have to charge you and that this is the sheriff's decision to do this and everything."
translation.ja: “君を逮捕するのは 保安官の判断だ”

translation.en: We all talked, and we… we decided we have to press charges.
translation.ja: “話し合いをした 結果なんだ”

translation.en: They took me back to take my mugshot.
translation.ja: 彼らは私の写真を撮り―

translation.en: They did my fingerprints,
translation.ja: 指紋を採取した

translation.en: and then Detective Adkins was like, "If you plead guilty, you know,
translation.ja: アドキンス刑事は言った “有罪を認めるなら―”

translation.en: we'll try and give a good word to the prosecutor that, you know, to go easy on you."
translation.ja: “減刑するよう 検事に口添えしてやる”

translation.en: I drove back to campus,
translation.ja: 運転して 大学まで戻った私は…

translation.en: and… I was just crying…
translation.ja: 運転して 大学まで戻った私は… ただ泣いたわ

translation.en: [tearfully] …because

translation.en: not only have I not told anybody that the police didn't believe me,

translation.en: but now I have to tell everybody
translation.ja: なのに今度は―

translation.en: that I'm being charged with filing a false police report.
translation.ja: 虚偽告訴罪で 逮捕されたなんて

translation.en: And…
translation.ja: それで…

translation.en: I’m so sorry.
translation.ja: ごめんなさい

translation.en: [director, off screen] What's making you so upset?
translation.ja: 何を思い出したの？

translation.en: Just remembering how scared I was and how…
translation.ja: すべての過程は…

translation.en: Just how I handled everything.
translation.ja: 本当に恐ろしかった

translation.en: That night, I didn't sleep good either. And when I woke up,
translation.ja: その夜は よく眠れなかった 翌朝 目覚めると ルームメイトが言った

translation.en: my roommate was like,
translation.ja: 翌朝 目覚めると ルームメイトが言った

translation.en: "Dyanie, what is this?"
translation.ja: “一体 何なの？”

translation.en: And it was the article that the police had posted on their Facebook page.
translation.ja: 彼女は― 〝ワシントン郡 保安官事務所〞 〝ワシントン郡 保安官事務所〞 〝ワシントン郡 保安官事務所〞 保安官事務所が投稿した 記事を見てた 保安官事務所が投稿した 記事を見てた

translation.en: I was getting Facebook messages from random people.
translation.ja: 〝恥知らず！〞 知らない人から メッセージが届いた 知らない人から メッセージが届いた 知らない人から メッセージが届いた 〝太ってる 刑務所を楽しんで〞

translation.en: Basically saying what you could only imagine,
translation.ja: 〝太ってる 刑務所を楽しんで〞 内容はご想像どおりよ 内容はご想像どおりよ 内容はご想像どおりよ 〝ウソつき女〞

translation.en: that I was going to rot in jail.
translation.ja: 〝ウソつき女〞 刑務所でくたばれとか― 刑務所でくたばれとか― 刑務所でくたばれとか― 〝ざまあみろ〞

translation.en: "People like you are the reason why cops get bad rep."
translation.ja: 〝ざまあみろ〞 “お前のせいで 警察の評判が下がる”とかね “お前のせいで 警察の評判が下がる”とかね

translation.en: My face was plastered everywhere,
translation.ja: 〝大学生が偽証〞 私の顔写真は拡散され―

translation.en: and I didn't want to stay on campus anymore.
translation.ja: 大学から離れたくなった

translation.en: There certainly seems to be a media obsession
translation.ja: マスコミは こう信じてる

translation.en: with this notion that, uh yeah, women are somehow, uh, falsely accusing
translation.ja: どういうわけか女性は― どういうわけか女性は― 作家 リサ･アバロス法務博士 作家 リサ･アバロス法務博士 作家 リサ･アバロス法務博士 性被害に遭ったと 偽証するとね

translation.en: all kinds of men of sexual assault. There's a huge media fascination.
translation.ja: 作家 リサ･アバロス法務博士 性被害に遭ったと 偽証するとね 性被害に遭ったと 偽証するとね

translation.en: Desi assaulted me that night.
translation.ja: デジーに襲われた

translation.en: [Carl, voiceover] The Gone Girl syndrome, right?
translation.ja: 「ゴーン･ガール」では―

translation.en: She intentionally lied to you about the assault.
translation.ja: 暴行されたと女性が偽証する

translation.en: I was being held prisoner.
translation.ja: 私は囚われの身だった

translation.en: [Carl] A… A lot of officers are told, usually from somebody in their own office,
translation.ja: 多くの警官は同僚から こう聞く

translation.en: "Oh, yeah. You know, half of them lie." Or, "Yeah, like, you know, two-thirds of them lie."
translation.ja: “半分か３分の２は ウソつきだ”

translation.en: False reports of sexual assault are actually pretty rare.
translation.ja: 性的暴行の偽証は珍しい

translation.en: The most reliable studies say 2% to 10%.
translation.ja: 信頼できる調査によると ２～10％ね

translation.en: The much, much bigger concern people should have, including men,
translation.ja: それより人々が 警戒すべきなのは― 性被害に遭うことよ

translation.en: is that they could be sexually assaulted.
translation.ja: 性被害に遭うことよ

translation.en: At least one out of every three women and at least one out of every six men
translation.ja: ３人に１人の女性と ６人に１人の男性が―

translation.en: will be a victim of sexual assault in their lifetime.
translation.ja: 性被害者になるの

translation.en: Then their perpetrator could be left to re-offend.
translation.ja: 加害者が 野放しになることもある

translation.en: [Rachel] I've been collecting news stories on false reporting cases
translation.ja: 私が集めた 虚偽報告の記事は―

translation.en: from mostly the past ten years.
translation.ja: 主に過去10年のものだ 主に過去10年のものだ 報道された事件

translation.en: But what is the media not including?
translation.ja: 報道された事件 では報道されていない 事例は？

translation.en: We needed to go beyond the headlines
translation.ja: 私たちは警察の記録を 精査することにした 私たちは警察の記録を 精査することにした 〝女性が有罪を認める〞

translation.en: and access the details in the police records.
translation.ja: 私たちは警察の記録を 精査することにした 〝女性が有罪を認める〞 私たちは警察の記録を 精査することにした

translation.en: To get that kind of information takes time, lawyers,
translation.ja: そのために必要なのは 時間や弁護士―

translation.en: and lots of Freedom of Information requests, or FOIAs.
translation.ja: ＦＯＩＡを用いた 情報開示請求だ

translation.en: It wasn't possible to FOIA every single police department in the United States.
translation.ja: 調査報道センター 編集者 すべての警察署に 請求は出せないから すべての警察署に 請求は出せないから すべての警察署に 請求は出せないから アマンダ･パイク

translation.en: So, it was just choosing a few counties to look at
translation.ja: いくつかの郡に 絞ることにした

translation.en: to try to get full case files so we could really do a deep dive.
translation.ja: 複数の事件の全資料を 精査するためにね

translation.en: What did the police investigation look like?
translation.ja: どんな捜査方法が使われ なぜ偽証が疑われたのか

translation.en: -Why did they make that flip? -[intriguing music continues]
translation.ja: どんな捜査方法が使われ なぜ偽証が疑われたのか どんな捜査方法が使われ なぜ偽証が疑われたのか 〝捜査報告書〞 〝捜査報告書〞

translation.en: [Rachel] Once we started requesting and even suing for police records,
translation.ja: 情報を得るため 訴訟まで起こした結果―

translation.en: I was drowning in documents.
translation.ja: 膨大な書類が届いた

translation.en: This took three years, but we were able to uncover records for 52 cases.
translation.ja: ３年かけて 52件の記録を手に入れたのだ

translation.en: I needed a team of journalists to help me make sense of what we were finding.
translation.ja: 資料を分析するチームが 必要になった 資料を分析するチームが 必要になった データリサーチ･チーム 資料を分析するチームが 必要になった

translation.en: [colleague] Four to five hundred pages in here.
translation.ja: 400～500ページある

translation.en: -[Rachel] And that was one case. -Like a… a needle in a haystack.
translation.ja: それで１件よ 膨大な量だ

translation.en: There were some cases where they were charged with false reporting within a day.
translation.ja: 中には１日で 偽証と判断された事件もある

translation.en: You're supposed to finish the sexual assault investigation first
translation.ja: まずは性的暴行の捜査を 終わらせて―

translation.en: to show that there was no assault or rape that occurred.
translation.ja: 暴行やレイプの事実がないと 確認すべきだ

translation.en: And then, once you've done that, you explore whether it was a false report.
translation.ja: その後 虚偽報告か 調べるはずなのに―

translation.en: -But it only happened in one of our cases. -Yeah.
translation.ja: １件しか その工程を経てない

translation.en: It's incredibly important as journalists to never take what police write as the…
translation.ja: 記者として大事なのは― 警察の資料に書かれた内容が 事実だと…

translation.en: as fact and truth.
translation.ja: 鵜呑(うの)みにしないこと

translation.en: [Rachel] It's only in the details that you start seeing
translation.ja: 分析から 明かされ始めたのは― 分析から 明かされ始めたのは― 〝シェルトン警察〞

translation.en: how a reporting victim becomes a suspect.
translation.ja: 〝シェルトン警察〞 被害者が容疑者になる工程だ 被害者が容疑者になる工程だ 被害者が容疑者になる工程だ 〝彼と戯れていた〞

translation.en: It was finally enough to start looking for patterns.
translation.ja: 〝気を引くため〞 一連の事件の 大局を見る時が来た 一連の事件の 大局を見る時が来た 一連の事件の 大局を見る時が来た 〝合意があると 信じている〞

translation.en: In more than half the cases we found, the reporting victim recanted.
translation.ja: 32件の被害者が証言を撤回 半数以上の事件で 被害者は証言を撤回した

translation.en: So if the investigator's writing that they recanted, what happened before that?
translation.ja: 被害者が 証言を撤回する前に― 何が起きたのかしら

translation.en: I wonder how many of these investigators
translation.ja: 何人の捜査官が ウソの情報を使い―

translation.en: used deceit before the person allegedly confessed or recanted?
translation.ja: 何人の捜査官が ウソの情報を使い― 自白や証言撤回に導いたか 知りたい

translation.en: [male investigator 1] I want you to really tell me the truth because I have this on video.
translation.ja: 真実を話してくれ 映像が残ってるんだ

translation.en: [male investigator 2] The evidence that we have in this case is not jiving with your side of the story.
translation.ja: 君の証言は 手元にある証拠と一致しない

translation.en: I've got the video. We've got video too.
translation.ja: 映像の証拠もあるんだ

translation.en: [Avalos] Police officers in this country are allowed to lie to you,
translation.ja: 警官はウソを認められてる

translation.en: and they don't have to indicate in the police report that they lied to you.
translation.ja: ウソをついた事実を 報告書に記載する義務もない ウソをついた事実を 報告書に記載する義務もない 〝映像と矛盾する〞

translation.en: They don't have to say that.
translation.ja: ウソをついた事実を 報告書に記載する義務もない ウソをついた事実を 報告書に記載する義務もない 〝監視カメラに 記録されている〞

translation.en: An officer will sometimes say, "We have video footage
translation.ja: 〝監視カメラに 記録されている〞 警官は映像がなくても こう言える 警官は映像がなくても こう言える 警官は映像がなくても こう言える 〝映像に 収められている〞

translation.en: showing the encounter, so I'm going to ask you some questions."
translation.ja: “君の映像があるから 正直に答えるんだ”

translation.en: "Now, be honest with me, because remember, I have video."
translation.ja: “君の映像があるから 正直に答えるんだ” “映像が残ってる”

translation.en: [victim] I believe evidence,
translation.ja: 証拠が正しいと思う

translation.en: so if you tell me you have video evidence that that didn't happen,
translation.ja: 証拠が正しいと思う 映像があるなら 事件は起きてない

translation.en: then, like, I guess I have to believe you.
translation.ja: あなたを信じないと

translation.en: [Avalos] You're not getting the truth out when you do these kinds of things.
translation.ja: そんな手を使っても 真実には届かない

translation.en: You are confusing a person who's already traumatized and already has memory difficulties.
translation.ja: トラウマを抱えた人を 混乱させるだけよ

translation.en: [male investigator 3] I know he's taken two polygraphs.
translation.ja: 彼をウソ発見器にかけた

translation.en: And I know…
translation.ja: ２度もな

translation.en: He didn't take two polygraphs. He's lying to her.
translation.ja: ２度 検査は受けてない

translation.en: -Oh wow. -Yeah.
translation.ja: 驚いたわ

translation.en: [Avalos] Getting the victim to retract their allegations is
translation.ja: 訴えを取り下げさせることを

translation.en: such an important strategy for some of these police officers
translation.ja: 重要視する警官は存在する

translation.en: because they haven't actually investigated the sexual assault thoroughly.
translation.ja: 彼らは性犯罪の捜査を 適切に行わず―

translation.en: They don't actually have any evidence no crime was committed
translation.ja: 犯罪ではないという証拠を 持ってない

translation.en: or attempted against the victim, and so their best bet
translation.ja: 犯罪ではないという証拠を 持ってない だから被害者に プレッシャーを与えて―

translation.en: is to pressure this person to retract their allegations
translation.ja: だから被害者に プレッシャーを与えて― 訴えを撤回させ 逮捕しようとする

translation.en: and then use that retraction to charge them.
translation.ja: 訴えを撤回させ 逮捕しようとする

translation.en: I was really curious to talk to you about Emma's case.
translation.ja: エマの件について 意見を聞きたいの

translation.en: You know, she reported this, and then five days later,
translation.ja: 彼女が通報してから５日後―

translation.en: you know, it flips on her entirely. They've got her in handcuffs.
translation.ja: 警察は彼女を逮捕した

translation.en: So I'm trying to understand how that happens for someone who,
translation.ja: そんなことが起きる 理由が知りたい

translation.en: you know, is adamant that this did, you know, happen to her, that she was assaulted.
translation.ja: 彼女は暴行を受けたと 何度も訴えてる

translation.en: [Rachel] So about an hour and a half into Emma's interview,
translation.ja: 事情聴取が始まって １時間半後―

translation.en: Investigator Akridge walks out of the room and locks the door behind him.
translation.ja: アクリッジ捜査官は離席し ドアにカギをかけた

translation.en: And then they put on a white noise machine.
translation.ja: ホワイトノイズを流してる

translation.en: So the white noise is
translation.ja: ノイズを流したのは―

translation.en: they're talking outside the door, and they just don't want her to hear.
translation.ja: 室外の会話を 聞かれたくないからだ

translation.en: [Rachel] So they leave it on for ten minutes.
translation.ja: 離席した時間は10分ほどね

translation.en: [Akridge sighs] Watching the video stuff that we have,
translation.ja: 監視カメラの映像を 確認すると―

translation.en: um, and it shows you and, I guess, Steven making out…

translation.ja: 証言によると彼女は―

translation.en: led into a bathroom by two men where an unwanted sexual act took place.
translation.ja: トイレで２人の男から 性行為を強要されたばかりだ

translation.en: [Cotto] So, they didn't pull you into the bathroom, correct?
translation.ja: トイレに押し込まれてはない

translation.en: [Nikki] No, but they did grab my arm at first.
translation.ja: でも腕を掴まれた

translation.en: [Cotto] Sure? I mean, and… and…
translation.ja: そうだね それは当然だろう

translation.en: and who wouldn't grab your arm?
translation.ja: それは当然だろう

translation.en: Look, you're a pretty young lady.
translation.ja: 君は美しい女性だ

translation.en: You… You really are. You're a pretty young lady. You're a nice young lady.
translation.ja: 若くて美しく性格もいい

translation.en: Can you walk me through as much as you can? -[Cotto] Mm-hmm. -The, um, technique that you used.
translation.ja: 聴取で用いた手法について 教えてほしいの

translation.en: So for an example, I'm… I'm gonna… I'm just gonna use you right now.
translation.ja: 君が事情聴取する相手だと 仮定しよう

translation.en: Okay, you are, um, engaged in what I'm saying.
translation.ja: 私の話に君は聞き入ってる

translation.en: How do I know that?
translation.ja: なぜだと？

translation.en: You were sitting back, and I was mirroring you in how you were sitting.
translation.ja: 私は君の姿勢をマネて 椅子に深く腰かけてる

translation.en: Right? So my hands were here. You were holding it. You were like this.
translation.ja: 君と同じように手も組んでた

translation.en: So you're studying body language as you're…
translation.ja: 私の身ぶりを観察するのね

translation.en: I am. I'm breaking down psychological barriers
translation.ja: 心理的な壁を崩すためだ

translation.en: to the point where… You know, and you can use ruse. A ruse.
translation.ja: それに捜査中 偽の証拠を 使うこともある

translation.en: -You know, I give it… -What is that?
translation.ja: 偽の証拠？

translation.en: A ruse is a tool that allows…
translation.ja: 真実を明かすために― 我々に与えられた ツールだよ

translation.en: that aids law enforcement to get to the truth.
translation.ja: 我々に与えられた ツールだよ

translation.en: -Okay. -It's actually not being truthful to them.
translation.ja: 相手を騙す行為だ

translation.en: [Rachel] Oh. Like what?
translation.ja: 例えば？

translation.en: Saying a lie. Saying like… like, "What if I tell you
translation.ja: ウソを言うんだ “どう思う？”

translation.en: that the intersection… this intersection at this particular time…
translation.ja: “この交差点では ある特定の時間に―”

translation.en: …um, you know, record… was recording."
translation.ja: “監視カメラが作動してた”

translation.en: But you don't have this footage.
translation.ja: でも映像はない

translation.en: -[Cotto] Maybe not. -Maybe not. Okay.
translation.ja: さあ なるほどね

translation.en: We use ruse every single day. Everybody does.
translation.ja: 毎日 偽の証拠は使われる

translation.en: [Cotto] What if I tell you
translation.ja: どう思う？

translation.en: I was able to obtain phone video
translation.ja: 私は携帯の動画を手に入れた

translation.en: that shows you at the wall speaking to them at the party.
translation.ja: パーティー会場で 君と彼らが話してる映像だ

translation.en: Who was the first person that walked out the bathroom?
translation.ja: トイレから最初に出たのは？

translation.en: 'Cause this is also videotaped.
translation.ja: それも映像に映ってる

translation.en: [Rachel] He repeatedly tells Nikki that she made up the whole thing,
translation.ja: ニッキーの話はウソだと 彼は繰り返した

translation.en: that she went into the bathroom willingly to have sex. She actually never says that.
translation.ja: 望んでトイレに入ったと 彼女は言ってない

translation.en: At some point, she just doesn't disagree with him.
translation.ja: でも ある時点で 否定することをやめた

translation.en: [Cotto] You didn't get raped in the bathroom. You knew that.
translation.ja: 君はレイプされてない

translation.en: And you know, afterwards you just wanted to distance yourself from it.
translation.ja: その事実から 距離を置きたかったんだろう

translation.en: This happened to you, and now somebody is accusing you
translation.ja: 暴行された後に 誰かから―

translation.en: of lying about it and fabricating the whole thing.
translation.ja: 全部 ウソだと 言われたら？

translation.en: [Cotto] I'll be right back, okay?
translation.ja: すぐ戻るよ

translation.en: [Avalos] In that situation, they need to get out of that encounter.
translation.ja: 被害者は その場から 逃げようとする

translation.en: Countless women, especially young women,
translation.ja: たくさんの若い女性が―

translation.en: have been talked into and cajoled into recanting
translation.ja: 証言の撤回に 追い込まれた

translation.en: because that's how they can get out of that situation.
translation.ja: 自分を守るためにね

translation.en: [Cotto] I mean, if you read my investigation, everything I do is fact-based.
translation.ja: 調べれば分かるが 私の捜査は事実に基づいてる

translation.en: I don’t have an opinion in here. There's not one opinion
translation.ja: 先入観を持ったことはない

translation.en: anywhere in my investigations.
translation.ja: どの事件の捜査でもだ

translation.en: Did you ever interview the two men?
translation.ja: 男性と話は？

translation.en: I did not. No, they didn't want to be interviewed.
translation.ja: いいや 彼らに拒否された

translation.en: -Oh, but you asked? -[Cotto] Oh, absolutely I did.
translation.ja: 連絡はした？ もちろんだ

translation.en: Oh yeah, absolutely I did, but they just didn't want to.
translation.ja: だが断られたんだ

translation.en: One gave a written statement to his school…
translation.ja: １人は声明文を出した

translation.en: Okay.
translation.ja: そう

translation.en: …but none gave me, uh, a statement personally.
translation.ja: だが直接 話は聞いてない

translation.en: Okay. It did come out recently
translation.ja: 最近 判明した情報よ

translation.en: that one of the men had previously been accused of a sexual assault
translation.ja: 最近 判明した情報よ 男の１人は性犯罪で 起訴された過去があった

translation.en: while at Sacred Heart a month before Nikki reported it to you.
translation.ja: 男の１人は性犯罪で 起訴された過去があった ニッキーが通報する １カ月前にね

translation.en: And I… I need to know if you knew that while you were investigating Nikki's case.
translation.ja: ニッキーの件を捜査中に この事実を知ってた？

translation.en: -Who are we talk-- -[Rachel] About… [bleep]
translation.ja: 誰だ？ 彼の名前は書類に書いてある

translation.en: No, it's on there. His name on there… [bleep]
translation.ja: 彼の名前は書類に書いてある

translation.en: Was it from… And… And that's from where?
translation.ja: その資料は どこから？

translation.en: -Sacred Heart University? -[Rachel] Yeah.
translation.ja: サクレッドハート大学？ ええ

translation.en: Yeah, no. So I… So during it, I was not aware.
translation.ja: 捜査中は― 手元になかった情報だ

translation.en: [Rachel] Does this change anything, you think?
translation.ja: 知ってれば何か変わったと？

translation.en: No, because I'm going to explain something to you. So, um…
translation.ja: いいや 説明しよう つまり…

translation.en: So… there was an individual,
translation.ja: それで… ある個人がいて…

translation.en: I'm positive I didn’t see it… [smacks lips]
translation.ja: 知らなかった

translation.en: …and then it… I… I'm positive it was not in the, um…
translation.ja: 捜査資料にもなかったはずだ

translation.en: the, uh… you know, wasn't of any evidence that I obtained.
translation.ja: 証拠品の中にはない

translation.en: [Rachel] Okay.
translation.ja: 分かった

translation.en: [Cotto] Okay. So let's do this. Can you… Let's stop this, and then let's look.
translation.ja: 撮影を中断して 資料を確認しよう

translation.en: [Rachel] Okay.
translation.ja: ええ

translation.en: Why not? Let's look.
translation.ja: 見てみるよ

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.ja: どうも

translation.en: [Rachel, voiceover] Detective Cotto says he couldn't find the man's name in the system.
translation.ja: 彼の名前はシステムにないと コットー刑事は言う

translation.en: A thorough investigation would have included looking into the suspect's past.
translation.ja: 捜査するなら容疑者の過去も 調べるべきだ

translation.en: Cotto interrogated Nikki but never interviewed either of the two men
translation.ja: コットーは男２人から 話を聞いてない

translation.en: who have since insisted the sex was consensual.
translation.ja: 彼らは合意の上だったと 主張し続け―

translation.en: Ultimately, Nikki plead guilty.
translation.ja: ニッキーは罪を認めた

translation.en: [Cotto, busily] The physical check. Now, let's see it.
translation.ja: 身体検査の記録だ

translation.en: [Rachel, voiceover] In the false reporting cases I went through, in almost half of them,
translation.ja: 調査した事件の半数近くで―

translation.en: it's not clear if the suspect was even interviewed or was identified.
translation.ja: 容疑者は 事情聴取を受けていない

translation.en: Which is, like, a really big deal. [chuckling]
translation.ja: 大問題よね

translation.en: It's, like, a very key part of an investigation.
translation.ja: 捜査に必要な 手順のはずなのに

translation.en: I'm just like, wow, there's so much more they could have done. There's just so much more they could have done.
translation.ja: 彼らには できることが たくさんあった

translation.en: [Akridge] There have been several investigators involved, and we have done a very, very thorough investigation.
translation.ja: 数人の捜査官が 徹底的に捜査したんだ

translation.en: [Carl] In Emma’s case, both the suspects weren't even identified.
translation.ja: エマの事件では 容疑者が特定されてない

translation.en: There were other friends that possibly knew him or other witnesses that… that knew him. Did they go to that school?
translation.ja: 警察は友人や目撃者に 話を聞かなかった

translation.en: She had a video that one of the suspects were on.
translation.ja: 容疑者の１人が映る映像は―

translation.en: I mean, they… they would have been… It would have been easy to find.
translation.ja: 大いに役立つ情報だろう

translation.en: I mean, if you're gonna do anything, you need to identify them two.
translation.ja: 容疑者特定は 最優先の仕事だ

translation.en: [Rachel] In Emma's police report, the surveillance video appears to be
translation.ja: 報告書によると 監視カメラの映像が―

translation.en: this really critical piece of evidence to justify her arrest.
translation.ja: 逮捕を決定づける証拠と されていた

translation.en: And if they just completely misidentified her, I would think that they'd care.
translation.ja: 人違いだったなら 警察は関心を持つはず

translation.en: Folks like Emma's family reach out to lawyers like myself,
translation.ja: エマの家族のような人々から 依頼を受ける

translation.en: uh, because we have a certain perspective.
translation.ja: どん底にいる人の 気持ちに― どん底にいる人の 気持ちに― エマの弁護士 リロイ･マクスウェル

translation.en: Uh, we understand what it's like to be at the bottom of the boot.
translation.ja: エマの弁護士 リロイ･マクスウェル 寄り添うことが できるからだ 寄り添うことが できるからだ

translation.en: We're essentially claiming that they withheld, uh, this video from us.
translation.ja: 警察は映像の提出を 拒否してきたが―

translation.en: We think it clearly exonerates Emma.
translation.ja: これでエマの容疑は 晴れるだろう

translation.en: [Rachel] There is now an opportunity to overturn the case,
translation.ja: 判決を覆せるかもしれない

translation.en: meaning that this could just be completely wiped from her record
translation.ja: エマの前科の記録を 完全に消せる

translation.en: as if this false reporting charge never happened.
translation.ja: 虚偽告訴罪の記録をね

translation.en: And if we win that and they determine that there was a constitutional violation,
translation.ja: 捜査手順が憲法違反だと 判断されれば―

translation.en: uh, then yeah, the case will be overturned.
translation.ja: 判決は覆るだろう

translation.en: [Rachel] I'm so used to seeing her documents
translation.ja: 今までの書類は― 原告がアラバマ州で エマは被告だった

translation.en: as the State of Alabama versus Emma Catherine Mannion.
translation.ja: 原告がアラバマ州で エマは被告だった

translation.en: Now it's Emma Catherine Mannion versus the State of Alabama.
translation.ja: 今度はエマが原告になる

translation.en: [Maxwell] All right.
translation.ja: よし

translation.en: -Thank you, guys. -[Maxwell] Thank you, Emma.
translation.ja: ありがとう こちらこそ

translation.en: -Uh, we'll be talking to you soon. -Thank you.
translation.ja: また近いうちに話そう

translation.en: The last few years have catapulted my healing.
translation.ja: この数年で― 心の傷は かなり癒えたわ

translation.en: Aw, it's good to see you.
translation.ja: 会えて嬉しい

translation.en: Because Rae's taken my word for my word and not just done it blindly
translation.ja: レイチェルは 私の言葉を信じた 妄信するんじゃなく―

translation.en: but gone and done the legwork that the police should have done.
translation.ja: 警察に代わり 足を使って裏取りしたの

translation.en: They have a tough job, you know. I would dot your I's and cross your T's.
translation.ja: ダイアニの公判前日 厳しい戦いになる 厳しい戦いになる 細部まで 気を抜かないようにね 細部まで 気を抜かないようにね 共同弁護士 ローラ･ダンの声

translation.en: Okay.
translation.ja: 分かった

translation.en: I'd like to run through the questions
translation.ja: 質問をおさらいして―

translation.en: and see if it lines up with what I'm looking from for you.
translation.ja: あなたと見解が一致してるか 確認したい

translation.en: So my first question would be, what are some of the reasons
translation.ja: １つ目は― 性被害者が正当な訴えを 取り下げる理由よ

translation.en: that a sexual assault victim might recant a legitimate report?
translation.ja: 性被害者が正当な訴えを 取り下げる理由よ

translation.en: [Avalos] It can be how she's treated by officers.
translation.ja: 警官の言動ね

translation.en: Um, if, uh, they used deception on her.
translation.ja: 偽の証拠を使ったりする

translation.en: You know, it's not strong, confident, middle-aged women that experience being charged with false reporting.
translation.ja: 彼女たちは自信に満ちた 中年女性じゃない

translation.en: -It's young women, vulnerable. -[Melissa] Right.
translation.ja: 若く傷つきやすい女性よ

translation.en: So she's somebody that is easy to take advantage of. -A perfect target. -Yeah. Mm-hmm.
translation.ja: 弱みに付け込むには うってつけの相手ね

translation.en: If… If she "false reported," then the sexual assault didn't happen, right?
translation.ja: 虚偽報告であれば 性犯罪は起きてない

translation.en: So they just completely forget about the sexual assault portion of it.
translation.ja: 性犯罪の捜査が 完全に抜け落ちてる

translation.en: I just want to really get her exonerated. -That's really the biggest thing. [sighs] -[Avalos] Okay.
translation.ja: 彼女が無罪だと どうしても証明したい

translation.en: [Dyanie] When we got that guilty verdict,
translation.ja: 有罪判決が出た時―

translation.en: Melissa was like, "It's okay. We're going to appeal."
translation.ja: 控訴するとメリッサは言った

translation.en: I'm hoping that it's a different outcome this time,
translation.ja: 今度は違う判決が出ることを 祈ってる

translation.en: but do I have the same faith in the criminal justice system
translation.ja: でも― 前のように刑事司法制度を 信用してるか？

translation.en: like I did before?
translation.ja: 前のように刑事司法制度を 信用してるか？

translation.en: No, I don't.
translation.ja: 信じてないわ

translation.en: [Rachel] How are you two feeling?
translation.ja: 今日の気分は？

translation.en: Nervous.
translation.ja: 緊張してる 緊張してる ダイアニの両親

translation.en: I just…
translation.ja: ダイアニの両親 ここには―

translation.en: This place doesn't bring me good memories.
translation.ja: カーラ･カルデナス ゲイブ･ベルメオ いい思い出がないんだ いい思い出がないんだ

translation.en: -Were you here for the last hearing, the-- -Yeah.
translation.ja: 前回も傍聴を？ ああ あの時は…

translation.en: Yeah, and it was…
translation.ja: ああ あの時は…

translation.en: [inhales deeply] It wasn't good.
translation.ja: 落胆した

translation.en: Yeah, I just felt so powerless, you know what I mean?
translation.ja: 自分が無力だと― 痛感したんだ

translation.en: I felt in a way that I never felt in almost my 30 years being in this country.
translation.ja: この国に来て30年で 初めて抱いた感情だった

translation.en: I think I feel what other people say it
translation.ja: 誰かが言うとおり―

translation.en: when they say that sometimes the justice system is not made for everybody.
translation.ja: 司法制度は万人のために 作られてない

translation.en: I was the one who said to her, you know, "Baby, you need to go the cops."
translation.ja: 私が娘に言ったんだ 警察に行くようにとね

translation.en: You know, "You need to report this." So I feel like, you know what I mean,
translation.ja: “通報しよう”と言った こう感じるんだ

translation.en: like, I… I sent my daughter to these freaking people here.
translation.ja: こう感じるんだ 私が娘を 忌々しい奴らの元に送った

translation.en: You know what I mean?
translation.ja: 私が娘を 忌々しい奴らの元に送った

translation.en: I could easily say, you know what? Don't worry about it, you know.
translation.ja: 心配するなと言いながらね

translation.en: It's just hard whenever you do everything that you're supposed to,
translation.ja: 正しい手順を踏んだのに―

translation.en: and things like that happen, you know?
translation.ja: こんなことが起きる

translation.en: I'm Laura Dunn, counsel for defendant.
translation.ja: 私はローラ･ダン 被告の弁護人です

translation.en: The judge believed me.
translation.ja: 判事は私を信じてくれた

translation.en: That's all I wanted from the first place… uh, the first time around,
translation.ja: 判事は私を信じてくれた 最初から望んでたことよ

translation.en: and I'm just… I'm still out of words for it,
translation.ja: 最初から望んでたことよ 言葉が出てこないけど―

translation.en: but it meant a lot more than anything when he said not guilty.
translation.ja: 言葉が出てこないけど― 無罪判決が出て 本当によかった

translation.en: This was a huge ruling.
translation.ja: 重要な判決よ

translation.en: False recantations happen when law enforcement
translation.ja: 証言の撤回が 起きるのは― Ｌ･Ｌ･ダン法律事務所 弁護士

translation.en: don't approach victims the right way and don't support them
translation.ja: 警察が被害者を 信用してないからよ ローラ･ダン

translation.en: and don't believe them at every step.
translation.ja: 警察が被害者を 信用してないからよ

translation.en: And I hope that changes,
translation.ja: この郡を起点にして 状況が変わるといい

translation.en: just this county and perhaps even broader, and you'll be part of that.
translation.ja: この郡を起点にして 状況が変わるといい あなたのおかげよ

translation.en: You'll be the reason for that.
translation.ja: あなたのおかげよ ダイアニは本当に頑張った

translation.en: Dyanie, you did the hard work, for real like…
translation.ja: ダイアニは本当に頑張った

translation.en: It feels so good to have… to have won,
translation.ja: 勝訴できて本当によかった

translation.en: but there's so many pieces to still pick up of her.
translation.ja: でも すべて 解決したわけじゃない

translation.en: Like… [scoffs] …they left a lot of damage in the wake. It's not so simple.
translation.ja: 彼女は心に大きな傷を 負ったの

translation.en: She wants to be a law enforcement officer. She had wanted to intern at the FBI right before this happened.
translation.ja: 事件前まで彼女は ＦＢＩで働きたがってた

translation.en: They took that from her. They took all of it from her.
translation.ja: その夢を彼らは奪ったの

translation.en: Before the story comes out, we, you know… we want to reach out to them again.
translation.ja: 記事の公開前に― 取材対象者に内容を伝えるの

translation.en: Like, just so you know,
translation.ja: 取材対象者に内容を伝えるの

translation.en: -this is what we're saying in our article. -Yes.
translation.ja: 取材対象者に内容を伝えるの ええ

translation.en: [Amanda] The question with the headline is, how do you accurately portray the story?
translation.ja: 見出しは主旨を 正確に伝えるものがいい

translation.en: She reported her rape to police, and when they didn't believe her, or something, you know, just a…
translation.ja: “レイプの事実を 信じない警察”みたいな感じ

translation.en: She reported a rape.
translation.ja: “レイプ被害を訴えたら”…

translation.en: She ended up in handcuffs or something like--
translation.ja: “手錠をかけられた”とか

translation.en: -Yeah. -Or we could play with something like
translation.ja: ええ もしくは―

translation.en: when a victim flips to a suspect.
translation.ja: “被害者が 容疑者になった”とかね

translation.en: [Amanda] Mm-hmm. Or police charged her with lying after they lied to her.
translation.ja: “ウソをついた警察が 彼女をウソつき呼ばわり”

translation.en: [Rachel] Yeah. Mm-hmm.
translation.ja: そうね

translation.en: [Amanda] What does it take to fight one of these charges? To get justice?
translation.ja: 正義を勝ち取るのは 簡単なことじゃない

translation.en: So, for Dyanie to get justice,
translation.ja: ダイアニの判決を 覆すために―

translation.en: it took, you know, at least half a dozen people that she had to bring on board,
translation.ja: ダイアニの判決を 覆すために― 少なくとも６人の支援者が 数百時間を費やした

translation.en: hundreds of hours of work, and it would have been
translation.ja: 少なくとも６人の支援者が 数百時間を費やした

translation.en: tens of thousands of dollars of legal help.
translation.ja: 本来なら費用は数万ドルよ

translation.en: For… And that's one case.
translation.ja: １件だけでね

translation.en: [Rachel, voiceover] As I get closer to publishing,
translation.ja: 記事の公開前―

translation.en: there's one question I keep coming back to.
translation.ja: １つの疑問が 頭から離れなかった

translation.en: [Rachel] I just… I just have this question.
translation.ja: 質問があるの

translation.en: So if police aren't believing someone,
translation.ja: 警察が被害者を信じないなら

translation.en: why not just dismiss the case?
translation.ja: なぜ被害届を受理するの？

translation.en: Why go through the trouble of making arrests?
translation.ja: 逮捕する必要がある？

translation.en: Those are easy.
translation.ja: 簡単だからだ

translation.en: All… If I can get her to recant, I'm done.
translation.ja: 訴えを撤回させれば 仕事が終わる

translation.en: I… I… I get an arrest and don't have to do a full investigation,
translation.ja: 検挙率は上がるし 捜査する必要もない

translation.en: and that's just another one off my desk.
translation.ja: 一件落着だ

translation.en: Or they cleared the sexual assault with an arrest,
translation.ja: 〝逮捕により 事件は解決〞 被害者を逮捕することで―

translation.en: and that's the arrest of the victim.
translation.ja: 〝逮捕により 事件は解決〞 事件を解決してる 事件を解決してる

translation.en: And then you… you go out,
translation.ja: それを公表し 辱めを受けさせる

translation.en: and you shame her.
translation.ja: それを公表し 辱めを受けさせる 〝虚偽報告により逮捕〞

translation.en: They're gonna teach that person the lesson.
translation.ja: 〝虚偽報告により逮捕〞 被害者に 罰を与えるためだ

translation.en: When a false report's made like this,
translation.ja: 今回のように 虚偽の報告をすれば―

translation.en: then the person that makes a report such as that,
translation.ja: 今回のように 虚偽の報告をすれば― 罪を償う必要がある

translation.en: you know, they… they need to suffer the consequences.
translation.ja: 罪を償う必要がある

translation.en: [Avalos] The main effect is the chilling effect.
translation.ja: 萎縮効果が生じるの

translation.en: They are chilling the reporting of sexual assault because other victims are going to be afraid to come forward.
translation.ja: 性被害の届け出を 他の被害者はためらう

translation.en: So the message they send to all the sexual assault survivors in their community
translation.ja: 警察は性暴力サバイバーに こう伝えてるの

translation.en: is that if the police don't believe you, they might prosecute you.
translation.ja: “警察は君を信じず 逮捕するかも”

translation.en: [Rachel, voiceover] First, you report being sexually assaulted,
translation.ja: 性被害に遭ったと 届け出を出すと―

translation.en: and then you have the police calling you a liar.
translation.ja: 警察から ウソつき呼ばわりされる

translation.en: Then the police will sometimes post about this on their own social media accounts.
translation.ja: 時に警察はＳＮＳに 記事を投稿することもある

translation.en: [female reporter] The sheriff's office says Dyanie Bermeo also reported the…
translation.ja: ダイアニ･ベルメオは…

translation.en: [Rachel, voiceover] Journalists pick this up and republish it without their own investigation.
translation.ja: その後 内容を精査せず 記者が事件を取り上げる

translation.en: 'Cause you're no longer a sexual assault victim,
translation.ja: 被害者でなくなれば―

translation.en: you do not have that right to privacy anymore.
translation.ja: 被害者でなくなれば― プライバシーは消える

translation.en: Once your name is in the press, it's everywhere. You can't put it back.
translation.ja: 名前が公表されれば その情報は永遠に残る

translation.en: [male caller] To Mrs. Yovino, I really hope you get the full two years
translation.ja: 〝男性の権利を訴える 活動家の主張〞 ヨビーノは２年 ムショに入るといい

translation.en: 'cause you fucking deserve it.
translation.ja: 〝男性の権利を訴える 活動家の主張〞 〝男性の権利を訴える 活動家の主張〞 当然の報いだ 〝男性の権利を訴える 活動家の主張〞

translation.en: [Rachel] These young women have no idea,
translation.ja: 〝男性の権利を訴える 活動家の主張〞 被害届を出すと どうなるか― 被害届を出すと どうなるか―

translation.en: when they go to report an assault, what could happen to them.
translation.ja: 彼女たちは知らなかった

translation.en: [Carl] Most of the victims in sexual assault are between ages of 14 and 26.
translation.ja: 大多数の性被害者は 14才から26才だ

translation.en: So you're dealing with somebody that's really young, and they just don't understand how it works.
translation.ja: つまり物事の仕組みを 知らない若者たちだ

translation.en: Even adults don't know how it works, but, um…
translation.ja: 大人も同じだが…

translation.en: [director, off screen] Why do you care so much?
translation.ja: なぜ協力を？

translation.en: Good question. Um…
translation.ja: いい質問だ

translation.en: My sister was sexually assaulted.
translation.ja: 妹が性的暴行を受けた

translation.en: Twice.
translation.ja: ２度ね

translation.en: The first time she was 13.
translation.ja: １度目は13才の時だ

translation.en: She came home, my mom called the police, they did zero.
translation.ja: 母が警察に通報したが 彼らは何もせず―

translation.en: They didn't even take a report.
translation.ja: 調書も取ってない

translation.en: And my sister got heavily into drugs,
translation.ja: 妹はドラッグに溺れた

translation.en: and, um… and I… a lot of that was from what happened to her.
translation.ja: 彼女の身に起きたことが 原因だ

translation.en: And, um… she became addicted, and then when she was 17 years old,
translation.ja: 彼女は依存症になり 17才になった頃―

translation.en: she was raped by two… two males
translation.ja: 彼女は依存症になり 17才になった頃― ２人の男からレイプされた

translation.en: and, uh, two suspects.
translation.ja: 容疑者は２人だ

translation.en: Cops came out. Did nothing.
translation.ja: 警察は何もしなかった

translation.en: And my sister just struggled for the rest of her life.
translation.ja: 彼女は最期まで苦しみ続けた

translation.en: And I… I know it came from that.
translation.ja: 性被害のせいでね

translation.en: So, I…
translation.ja: だから私は…

translation.en: I look at my victims, and I see…
translation.ja: 被害者を見ると…

translation.en: [choking up] I see her.
translation.ja: 妹を思い出す

translation.en: That's why.
translation.ja: だからだ

translation.en: [trainee] I want to thank you for coming in today.
translation.ja: 今日はありがとう

translation.en: I'm here to help you. Okay?
translation.ja: 私は味方だ 君はパーティーへ？

translation.en: -You went to the party? -[victim actress] Yeah.
translation.ja: 私は味方だ 君はパーティーへ？ ええ

translation.en: -[trainee] Okay. Okay. -[victim actress] I got too drunk. And I got sick.
translation.ja: 飲みすぎて気分が悪かったの

translation.en: I should have just gone home.
translation.ja: 帰ればよかった

translation.en: [Carl] What I think needs to be done is, obviously, training.
translation.ja: 性犯罪の 捜査に関する研修 警官に必要なのは訓練だ

translation.en: You have detectives who've never been trained in sex crimes,
translation.ja: 性犯罪の 捜査に関する研修 性犯罪捜査の訓練を 受けてない者が多い 性犯罪捜査の訓練を 受けてない者が多い

translation.en: especially in smaller agencies.
translation.ja: 性犯罪捜査の訓練を 受けてない者が多い

translation.en: If you asked a question twice, then the victim feels, you know, you're doubting them.
translation.ja: ２度 同じ質問をすれば 被害者は不信感を抱く

translation.en: Just bear in mind, if you do it too much, down the road, she's gonna be thinking… you know--
translation.ja: 彼女たちに詰め寄れば こう思われる

translation.en: -[victim actress] You don't believe me. -Right.
translation.ja: 信じてない

translation.en: -[trainee] Or even paying attention. -You're not paying attention.
translation.ja: 話を聞いてない そう 関心がないと思われる

translation.en: You're not listening.
translation.ja: そう 関心がないと思われる

translation.en: A lot of detectives will come up to me,
translation.ja: 多くの刑事から―

translation.en: they're like, "Yeah, we really want to work these cases but no training."
translation.ja: 捜査したいが経験がないと 相談を受ける

translation.en: [Akridge] But I'm telling you right now, if you continue to lie to me, this is about to go south.
translation.ja: ウソの証言をやめないと マズいことになる

translation.en: [Emma] I'm not lying. I'm not.
translation.ja: ウソじゃない

translation.en: They were treating the victim in the same interview as a suspect.
translation.ja: 彼は被害者を 容疑者扱いしてる

translation.en: Of course there's gonna be inconsistencies. Which we already established, the inconsistencies.
translation.ja: 警官が誘導するから 証言に矛盾が出る

translation.en: They automatically started kind of putting the burden of proof on the victim.
translation.ja: 犯罪が起きた事実を― 被害者に 証明させようとしてる

translation.en: We've been talking all day today about, uh, two survivors
translation.ja: 今日 紹介した事件例の― 被害者２人に これから話をしてもらう

translation.en: that are gonna come in and do their, uh, impact statement.
translation.ja: 被害者２人に これから話をしてもらう

translation.en: And they're here today. Uh, honestly, I've been training a long time,
translation.ja: 被害者２人に これから話をしてもらう 長年 訓練してるが―

translation.en: and to get survivors to come in to talk at… on any level, uh, is a really tough thing to do.
translation.ja: 被害者の話を聞くのは つらいものだ

translation.en: Do I want to go up in front all these cops and tell them this?
translation.ja: 警官たちの前で発言したい？

translation.en: -[Emma laughs] -No, not really.
translation.ja: いいえ

translation.en: I don't wanna hear, "I'm sorry."
translation.ja: 謝罪は不要よ

translation.en: -[Emma] Yeah, that one. -Like… I like…
translation.ja: そうね 参加者は何もしてない

translation.en: Like you didn't do this to me.
translation.ja: 参加者は何もしてない

translation.en: -I've had enough… -[Dyanie] Of I'm sorry's. -…like, of pity cries for Emma. -[Dyanie] Yes.
translation.ja: 同情されることに ウンザリしてる

translation.en: I… That's not… [chuckles] That's not where I'm at.
translation.ja: もう そんな時期は過ぎてる

translation.en: And… And I know that
translation.ja: それに事件ごとに―

translation.en: case to case is different,
translation.ja: 事情は異なる

translation.en: longevity is diff… Like, this is year five for me.
translation.ja: 私にとっては ５年前の出来事よ

translation.en: To the right.
translation.ja: 右へどうぞ

translation.en: [Emma] I was 18 years old. I was raped
translation.ja: 18才の時にレイプされた

translation.en: in the back of a vehicle by a stranger
translation.ja: 車の後部座席でね

translation.en: with his friend who stood outside the car watching.
translation.ja: 彼の友達は車外で見てた

translation.en: I walked through my statement
translation.ja: 状況を説明したけど―

translation.en: and was bluntly told by the detective that they did not believe me.
translation.ja: 刑事から信じられないと 言われた

translation.en: That he wanted to help me, but he couldn't help a liar.
translation.ja: ウソつきは助けられないとね

translation.en: I fell victim to a rapist
translation.ja: 被害者なのに―

translation.en: and was never given the privilege or dignity to process my assault.
translation.ja: 私が持ってるはずの権利は 与えられなかった

translation.en: If a survivor is coming to you, and they need your help,
translation.ja: あなたに助けを求めてきた 被害者を―

translation.en: and you don't help them, there's a monster walking around free.
translation.ja: 助けなければ 怪物が野放しになるの

translation.en: If you assume immediately that they're lying,
translation.ja: 偽証報告だと 決めつけることで―

translation.en: if you feel like your job would be easier
translation.ja: 仕事が楽になると感じる？

translation.en: if it was swept under the rug, or if you're tired of all the paperwork,
translation.ja: もしくは書類仕事に ウンザリしてるなら―

translation.en: find a new career.
translation.ja: 転職して

translation.en: [Dyanie] I thought they were coming down to the campus to help me,
translation.ja: 警察が大学に来たのは―

translation.en: but in reality, they came down ready to interrogate me.
translation.ja: 私を助けるためでなく 取り調べるためだった

translation.en: There is a law saying, like, you know, police officers can lie to people, and it's okay.
translation.ja: 警察はウソをつくことを 認められてる

translation.en: I'm very sorry, and I'm telling you right now,
translation.ja: でも悪いけど こう思うわ

translation.en: I don't think you should lie to sexual assault survivors.
translation.ja: 性被害者に ウソをつくべきじゃない

translation.en: [Emma] I applaud you all for being here,
translation.ja: 研修を受けてくれて 感謝してる

translation.en: but I think this should be standard practice across the board.
translation.ja: でも すべての警官が 受けるべきよ

translation.en: [Avalos] This is a problem we can solve.
translation.ja: これは解決できる問題よ

translation.en: We need to ensure
translation.ja: 大事なのは 犯罪が 起きてないという証拠を―

translation.en: that police departments are not relying on a victim recantation as their evidence
translation.ja: 大事なのは 犯罪が 起きてないという証拠を― 被害者の証言撤回に 頼らないことよ

translation.en: that no crime was committed or attempted.
translation.ja: 被害者の証言撤回に 頼らないことよ

translation.en: If they close a sexual assault case without a thorough investigation,
translation.ja: 適切な捜査をせず 事件を終わらせたり―

translation.en: if they accuse the victim without evidence, then they should be held accountable and risk losing federal funding.
translation.ja: 被害者を追及するなら 連邦予算の削減を行うべきね

translation.en: [Rachel, voiceover] So much of my investigation was focused on police process.
translation.ja: 警察の捜査方法に焦点を当て 取材を続けてきた

translation.en: But it's also the prosecutors,
translation.ja: でも責任は検察官や―

translation.en: legislators, the judges, even the mayors.
translation.ja: 議会議員 判事 市長にもある

translation.en: There is an institution of people who allow it to happen.
translation.ja: 公的機関が こうした事態を 容認してるの

translation.en: [Rachel, voiceover] I've been working on this story for four years
translation.ja: ４年に渡る取材の中で―

translation.en: and found about 200 cases so far
translation.ja: 200の事件を見つけてきた

translation.en: where alleged victims of sexual assault were turned into suspects.
translation.ja: 性被害を訴えた人物が 容疑者となる事件だ

translation.en: It's impossible to say how often law enforcement is doing this,
translation.ja: こうした事件が起きる頻度は 分からないけど―

translation.en: but here's what we do know.
translation.ja: これが調査結果だ

translation.en: There are more than 460,000 sexual assaults in the United States every year.
translation.ja: 毎年 46万件以上の性犯罪が アメリカで発生してる

translation.en: Only 30% of those are reported to the police,
translation.ja: 被害届が出されるのは そのうち30％だけ

translation.en: and only 1% of perpetrators are ever prosecuted.
translation.ja: 起訴される加害者は１％だ

translation.en: There's so little justice for victims,
translation.ja: 被害者は公平に扱われず―

translation.en: and when law enforcement turns them into the suspects,
translation.ja: 警察から 容疑者にされることもある

translation.en: it demands the question, is reporting worth the risk?
translation.ja: 危険を冒しても 被害届を出す意味とは？

translation.en: This was my first big solo investigative piece.
translation.ja: これは 私が初めて手がけた 特集記事だ

translation.en: It's nerve-racking.
translation.ja: 正直―

translation.en: I mean, I don't know if I'll sleep the night that this comes out, to be honest with you.
translation.ja: 記事が公開される夜は 眠れないと思う

translation.en: There's a lot of power that stories like this can have.
translation.ja: こうした記事には 大きな影響力がある

translation.en: Look, I'm sorry if I'm, you know, pestering you at this point,
translation.ja: 何度も電話して 申し訳ないけど―

translation.en: but I… it's really important that I speak with you.
translation.ja: どうしても話したいの

translation.en: [Rachel, voiceover] Anybody in my story, I want them to be aware of it. That it's coming out.
translation.ja: 取材を受けた人たちには それを知ってほしい

translation.en: Gonna be quite a few people that won't like this story,
translation.ja: 気分を害す人も多いはず

translation.en: but that's… you know, that's journalism.
translation.ja: それがジャーナリズムよ

translation.en: That's journalism, baby.
translation.ja: ジャーナリズムってやつよ

translation.en: [Rachel, voiceover] The footage shows Emma walking with the alleged assailants
translation.ja: エマと 加害者とされる男たちが

translation.en: moments before her alleged assault.
translation.ja: 事件直前に歩いてる映像だ

translation.en: It corroborates exactly her description of where she was and with whom.
translation.ja: その内容は彼女の証言を 裏づけるものだった

translation.en: [Emma, over recording] It was just myself, Steven,
translation.ja: 私と青いシャツを着た スティーヴンと―

translation.en: the guy in the blue shirt, and… [bleep].
translation.ja: 私と青いシャツを着た スティーヴンと― もう１人は…

translation.en: [host] From the Center for Investigative Reporting and PRX,
translation.ja: 調査報道センターと ＰＲＸが贈る―

translation.en: this is Reveal.
translation.ja: 「リビール」を放送中

translation.en: Today, we're talking with reporter, Rae de Leon
translation.ja: 今日は記者のデレオンに 話を聞きます

translation.en: about her yearslong investigation
translation.ja: 彼女は数年に渡って―

translation.en: that raises troubling questions about how police investigate sexual assault.
translation.ja: 警察による 性犯罪の捜査方法を調査し…

translation.en: -[Rae] Hi, Al. -[Al] Hey, Rae.
translation.ja: どうも やあ
